gurmukhi: eyk bDU juq bRwhmn Qo iqh Xw jgu bIc bfo duKu pwXo ] dUKq hÍY iek idvs khXo iqh imqR hY mo pRB jo jgrwXo ]
transliteration: Ek Badhoo Jout Braahman Tho Tih Yaa Jag(u) Beech Bado Doukh(u) Paayo|| Dookhat Hvai Ik Divas Kahyo Tih Mitra Hai Mo Prabh Jo Jagraayo||
translation: There was a married Brahmin, who had undergone great suffering; being greatly afflicted, one day he said (to his wife) that Krishna was his friend;

gurmukhi: qw kI qRIXw khXo jwhu qhw sun mwnq BXo iqh mUMf mufwXo ] qMdl dY idj dwrdI hwQ su duAwrvqI hU kI Er isDwXo ]2405]
transliteration: Taa Kitreeyaa Jaab(u) Tahaa Soun Maanat Bhyo Tih Moondd Mudaayo|| Tandal Dai Dij Daardihaath Duaarvatihoo Kior Sidhaayo||2405||
translation: His wife said, “You go to your friend;” the Brahmin agreed; after getting his head shaved, that poor man took a small quantity of rice and started towards Dwarka/2405.

gurmukhi: hau Aru sXwm sMdIpn ky giH bIc pVy ihq hY Aiq hI kir ] hau icq mY Dir sXwm rihE rhY hÍY hY su sXwmih mo icq mY Dir ]
transliteration: Hau Ar(u) Syaam Sandeepan Ke Grah(i) Beech Pade Hit Hai At(i) Hikar(i)|| Hau Chit Mai Dhar(i) Syaam Rahio Rahai Hvai Hai Su Syaamah(i) Mo Chit Mai Dhar(i)||
translation: I and Krishna have been studying together with out teacher Sandipan, when I remember Krishna, then he may also be remembering me;

gurmukhi: dY Dn pwie Gno Gir mY kCu dInn dyqn nYk kiRpw kir ] eIs lhY ikDo moh inhwr kY kYsI kiRpw kir hY hm pY hir ]2406]
transliteration: Dai Dhan Paae Ghano Ghar(i) Mai Kachh(u) Deenan Detan Naik Kridaa Kar(i)|| Oos Lahai Kidho Moh Nihaar Kai Kaisikridaa Kar(i) Hai Ham Pai Har(i)||2406||
translation: He gives so much to the helpless people, he may also kindly give me something; but I cannot say, only the Lord knows, whether he will do such thing with me.”2406.

gurmukhi: mwrg nwK kY ibpR jbY giH sRI jdubIr ky BIqr AwXo ] sRI biRjnwQ inhwrq qwih su ibpR sudwmw iehY ThrwXo ]
transliteration: Maarag Naakh Kai Bipra Jabai Grah(i) Srijadoubeer Ke Bheetar Aayo Dribrijnaath Taah(i) Su Bipra Sydaamaa Ihai Thahraayo||
translation: After finishing his journey, when the Brahmin reached the residence of Krishna, Krishna recognised him that he was the Brahmin Sudama;

gurmukhi: Awsn qy auT Awqur huie Aiq pRIq bFwie kY lYby kau DwXo ] pwie pirE iqh ko hir jI iPr sXwm BnY auT kMT lgwXo ]2407]
transliteration: Oosan Te Outh Aatur Hue At(i) Preet Badhaae Kai Laibe Kau Dhaayo|| Paae Pario Tih Ko Har(i) Jiphir Syaam Bhanai Outh Kanth Lagadyo||2407||
translation: He advanced forward to receive him, affectionately, leaving his seat; he touched his feet and then hugged him.2407.

gurmukhi: lY iqh mMdr mwih gXo iqh kO Aiq hI kir Awdru kIno ] bwru mMgwie qhI idj ky doaU pwien DÍY crnwmiRq lIno ]
transliteration: Lai Tih Mandar Maah(i) Gado Tih Kau At(i) Hikar(i) Aadar(u) Keeno|| Baar(u) Manade Tahidij Ke Dooo Paain Dhvai Charnaamrit Leeno||
translation: He took him to his palace and welcomed and honoured him; he caused water to be brought, with which he washed the feet of the Brahmin; he also drank the washings of the feet;

gurmukhi: JOprI qy iqh TwN hir jU suB kMcn ko pun mMdr kIno ] qau n sikE su ibdw kir ib`pih sXwm BnY iqh rMc n dIno ]2408]
transliteration: Jhaouparite Tih Thaandhar(i) Joo Soubh Kanchanndko Poun Mandar Keeno|| Tau Na Sakio Su Bidaa Kar(i) Pippah(i) Syaam Bhanai Tih Ranch Na Deeno||2408||
translation: On the other side, he transformed his hut into a palace; doing all this, he bade farewell to the Brahmin and apparently, he did not give him anything.2408.

gurmukhi: jb idj ky giH pVq qb moso huqo groh ] Ab lwlc bs hir Bey kCU n dIno moh ]2409]
transliteration: Jab Dij Ke Grah(i) Padat Tab Moso Houtodaroh|| Ab Laalach Bas Har(i) Bhae Kachhodh Na Deeno Moh||2409||
translation: When we studied at the house of our teacher, he loved me, but now the Lord has become covetous, therefore he did not give me anything.2409.

gurmukhi: jo biRjnwQ kI syv krY pun pwvq hY bhuqo Dn soaU ] log khw iqh Bydih pwvq AwpnI jwnq hY pun EaU ]
transliteration: Jo Brijnaath Kisev Darai Poun Paavat Hai Bahouto Dhan Sooo|| Log Kahaa Tih Bhedah(i) Paavat Aapanijaanat Hai Poun Ooo||
translation: He, who serves Krishna, he obtains extreme wealth, but the people do not understand this mystery and only comprehend according to their understanding;
